comments:
Driver : Eclipse 3.1M6, emf I200505050300, wtp-1.0M4
JVM : IBM 1.4.2 SR1a
Platform : WindowsXP Japanese sp2

Steps
1. open TCP/IP monitor at context menu at Server view
2. operate start, stop, edit, or add TCP/IP monitor

Hi Fuse-san, please assign this to deboer@ca.ibm.com. Thanks.

Hi,

This is a non-DBCS related bug, and shouldn't cause any problems other than the
error in the log. I've fixed it in the HEAD stream.

I'm still seeing an error in 20050513 driver. Here is the scenario.
1. start up Tomcat 5.0
2. Select Monitoring > Monitor port 8080 (HTTP) at the server's context menu
3. open Monitor Ports at Monitoring > Properties... at the context menu
4. click Stop for HTTP 8080, then click OK to close
5. open Window > Preferences... Internet > TCP/IP Monitor
6. Click Start for localhost:8080 HTTP, then OK to close
7. open Monitoring > Properties... at the server's context menu
Here is a problem ; Status for HTTP is displayed as "Stopped"
8. click Edit.. for the HTTP
got follwoing error stack
